name: Lodestone
effect:
The Anchor creates a Burst 2 area of gravitomagnetic interference. While active, the Anchor and hostile characters in the area are Slowed and cannot teleport into or out of the area. Allies in the area are not valid targets for ranged attacks made from outside the area. Other characters with Lodestone are unaffected by this system.

These effects last the end of the Anchor’s next turn, until it uses this system again, or until it’s Stunned, overheated, or destroyed.

name: Gravity Cannon
effect: If this weapon’s Knockback causes a target to collide with an obstruction or mech, they stop moving and become Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Ponderous
effect: The Anchor receives only half of any hostile non-teleport involuntary movement.

name: Reality Anchor
effect: All characters affected by Lodestone gain Immunity to Intangible. In addition, they may target and affect Intangible characters and objects, and they may be targeted and affected by Intangible characters. Lastly, allies in line of sight treat spaces in Lodestone’s area as valid destinations for teleportation, which cannot be redirected.

name: Omninet Grounding
effect: Allies affected by Lodestone are not valid targets for tech actions made from outside its area.

name: Newtonian Amplifier
effect: The Anchor creates a Burst 2 area of gravitic energy. Hostile characters in the area or directly above it must pass a Hull save or first be Immobilized until the end of their next turn and then knocked Prone.

name: Magnetic Reversal
trigger: An allied character in the Anchor’s Sensors takes damage from a melee attack.
effect: The allied character gains Resistance to all damage from the attack, and the attacker must pass a Hull save or be pushed 3 spaces away from their target and knocked Prone.

name: Null-Grav Motivator
effect: The Anchor creates a Blast 3 area in Sensors extending 6 spaces high. This area becomes a zero-g area that lasts until the Anchor uses this system again. Characters within the area upon its creation must pass an Agility save or be Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Marathon Arquebus
effect: This weapon does not attack allies. Non-Drone allies in the affected area gain Overshield {2/3/4}.

name: Power Surge
effect: An ally with Overshield within Sensors becomes supercharged. Their weapon attacks gain AP and Reliable {1/1/2} until they lose all Overshield or until the Capacitor uses this action again.

name: Reciprocity
effect: The Capacitor deploys with Overshield {2/3/4}. Whenever it grants Overshield to another character, it gains the same amount of Overshield.

name: Deflecting Shot
trigger: An allied character that can be targeted by the Marathon Arquebus is hit by an attack.
effect: The Capacitor interrupts the attack with a Skirmish using the Marathon Arquebus, dealing half damage, Heat, or Burn to all targets. The triggering allied character must be included in the attack’s area.

name: Quickening Bolt
effect: An ally with Overshield within Sensors becomes quickened. The target may Boost 1/round as a free action until they lose all Overshield or until the Capacitor uses this action again.

name: Purifying Lightning
effect: Allies that already have Overshield may clear up to one condition when affected by the Marathon Arquebus.

name: Cyclic Discharge
effect: The Capacitor loses all Overshield and cannot gain more until the start of its next turn. Its next weapon attack deals Energy bonus damage equal to the Overshield lost, and all targets hit by the attack are Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Amplifier Drone
effect:
Amplifier Drone (Size 1/2, HP {5/8/10}, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone, Overshield)

This drone can be deployed to a space within Sensors and line of sight. While deployed, it projects a Burst 2 electrified area. The Capacitor’s allies in the area that gain any Overshield increase the amount gained by +1. Hostile characters that enter the area or end their turn there receive Lock On and cease to be Invisible or Hidden. Only one drone may be deployed at a time; deploying a new drone destroys the old one.

name: Phase Shift
effect: This character is Intangible before its first turn and during its turns. While Intangible, they can target and affect tangible characters and objects, but only deal half damage, Heat, Burn or to all targets.

name: Quantum Bond
effect:
The Ghost bonds with one tangible adjacent allied character, becoming Intangible and sharing one of the target’s spaces. As a protocol, the bonded target may inflict 1 Heat upon both themselves and the Ghost to gain the Ghost’s Phase Shift feature until the end of their turn. However, if a hostile tech action affects either bonded character, the other character also suffers the action’s effects.

While bonded, the Ghost moves with the bonded target’s voluntary movement. The bond ends if the Ghost uses this system again, no longer shares a space with the bonded target, or is Stunned, Jammed, overheated, or destroyed.

name: Paradox State
effect: The next time a hostile action is taken against a character bonded with the Ghost, they immediately become Intangible during that action. The action is still taken and affects other targets as normal.

name: Ghastly Vigor
effect: Gain Bolster (Lancer, p. 69) as an option for Quick Tech. Tech attacks against targets Bolstered by this character receive +1 Difficulty.

name: Superimpose Firmament
effect: The Ghost imposes the Firmament upon a Burst 2 area. Characters, objects, terrain, zones, and sitrep objectives are Intangible while within the area (so only Intangible characters can interact with zones and sitrep objectives within). The area lasts until the end of the Ghost’s next turn.

name: String Theory Marionette
effect: A character bonded with the Ghost may Skirmish or use the Quick Tech action as a reaction, dealing half damage, Heat, or Burn to all targets.

name: Wavefunction Collapse
trigger: A hostile action is taken against a character bonded with the Ghost.
effect: Immediately use Paradox State, if able.

name: Spectral Flight
effect: Characters affected by Phase Shift may treat all of their movement as flying.

name: Split Timestream
trigger: A character bonded with the Ghost would take structure damage or stress.
effect: The triggering character instead regains all HP and clears all Heat, and the Ghost takes the structure damage or stress instead.

name: Monomolecular Throwing Axe
effect: If the attacker is not Engaged, this weapon deals double damage (excluding bonus damage), and the target is Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: Cleaving Retrieval
effect: The Hatchet retrieves one of its Thrown weapons not used to attack this turn, regardless of Range. If the weapon was adjacent to the Hatchet, it may immediately force one adjacent character to pass an Agility save or be pushed 2 spaces away from the Hatchet and take 4 Kinetic damage. On a success, the target takes half damage and isn’t pushed.

name: Flip Kick
effect: When the Hatchet retrieves a Thrown weapon, it may fly up to 3 spaces in any direction, ignoring engagement and reactions.

name: Whirlwind Kick
effect: Adjacent hostile characters must pass a Hull save or be pushed 2 spaces away from the Hatchet and be Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Plasma Knife
effect: When retrieving this weapon, Cleaving Retrieval’s damage becomes Energy AP damage.

name: Rocket Bola
on_hit: If the attacker is not Engaged, the target must pass a Hull save or be Immobilized until the end of their next turn.

name: Reckless Dive
trigger: A hostile character adjacent to one of the Hatchet’s Thrown weapons damages the Hatchet.
effect: The Hatchet moves up to its Speed directly towards the attacker and then activates Cleaving Retrieval. If this forces the triggering character to make a save, the Hatchet gains Resistance to all damage from the triggering attack.

name: Return to Sender
trigger: A character targets the Hatchet with an action with the Thrown, Arcing, Seeking, or Grenade tag.
effect: The Hatchet interrupts the triggering action, changing the action’s target from itself to the triggering character as if the action originated from the Hatchet. If the action affects one or more areas, the Hatchet moves any areas that include itself to instead include the triggering character and exclude itself (if possible). The triggering character still counts as taking the action.

name: “Minuano” Kinetic Saber
effect:
During the Kensei’s turn, it may attack using the Charged profile if this weapon has been sheathed since the start of the Kensei’s turn.

This weapon becomes unsheathed after attacking.

name: “Minuano” Kinetic Saber (Charged)
effect:
During the Kensei’s turn, it may attack using the Charged profile if this weapon has been sheathed since the start of the Kensei’s turn. If it does, targets hit are Shredded until the end of the scene.

This weapon becomes unsheathed after attacking.

name: Mass Driver Sheathe
effect: The Kensei sheathes its “Minuano” Kinetic Saber, assuming a defensive stance. While its weapon remains sheathed, the Kensei is Slowed, its voluntary movement counts as moving in difficult terrain, and it receives only half the push, pull, or knockback from hostile sources. The Kensei may unsheathe its weapon as a quick action.

name: Mach Parry
trigger: A weapon attack hits and deals damage to the Kensei while its weapon is sheathed.
effect: The Kensei unsheathes its weapon and gains Overshield {3/5/7} before taking damage.

name: 40mm Hand Cannon
effect: Activating Mass Driver Sheathe reloads this weapon.

name: Gaussian Blur
effect: Before activating Mass Driver Sheathe, the Kensei may immediately move its Speed in a straight line, ignoring obstructing characters, engagement, and reactions. It deals {3/4/5} Kinetic AP damage to characters it passes through.

name: Posture Break
effect: Targets hit with the “Minuano” Kinetic Saber using the Charged profile must make a Hull save or become Dazed (Conditions & Statuses, Appendix A) until the end of their next turn.

name: Disarming Retaliation
effect: As part of Mach Parry, after the triggering attack resolves, the Kensei may move its Speed towards the attacker and Skirmish against them with its “Minuano” Kinetic Saber. On a hit, the attack deals no damage; instead, the Kensei disarms one of the target’s equipped weapons (excluding integrated weapons), flinging it to a space in Range 5. The target cannot use the weapon until they retrieve it (as if the weapon had the Thrown tag).

name: Daunting Grudge
effect: The Kensei makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a hit, the target is Impaired and cannot voluntarily move closer to the Kensei until the end of their next turn.

name: Compelled Duel
effect:
A hostile character within Sensors and line of sight enters a duel with the Knight. While in the duel, the target must make a Systems save at the start of each of their turns. On a failure, until the start of the target’s next turn, they receive +3 Difficulty on all attacks that don’t include the Knight as a target, and they cannot voluntarily move away from the Knight.

The duel lasts until the end of the scene or until one of the opponents is destroyed. Each character cannot enter another duel until the end of this duel.

name: Champion’s Greatsword
on_hit: The target gains Lock On. If they are affected by Compelled Duel, they are also Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: Templar’s Shield
effect: The Knight raises a shield, gaining Resistance to all damage from its duel opponent until the end of its next turn.

name: Hero’s Banner
effect:
Hero’s Banner (Size 1/2, HP {12/15/18}, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Deployable, Shield)

The Knight deploys a banner that projects a Burst 3 area in an adjacent space. Allied characters within the area gain Resistance to all damage. If this banner is destroyed, allied characters in the area are Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: Sweeping Blows
effect: The Champion’s Greatsword may attack in a Cone 3 area and gains Knockback 2.

name: Punishing Blow
trigger: The Knight’s duel opponent uses a hostile action that does not include the Knight as a target.
effect: The Knight Skirmishes the triggering character, knocking them Prone on a hit.

name: Second Wind
effect: The Knight regains half of its HP and clears one condition. The Knight can take this action even if it would be prevented from taking actions on its turn.

name: Mighty Throw
effect: The Knight throws an adjacent character, pushing them away from the Knight and ignoring terrain and obstructions. Allied characters are thrown up to 5 spaces. Hostile characters must pass a Hull save or be thrown up to 3 spaces and knocked Prone.

name: Center Stage
effect: The Mesmerist cannot Hide nor become Hidden.

name: Mirror Image
effect: The Mesmerist deploys with 1 mirror image occupying its space. In addition, 1/round when the Mesmerist hits with a tech attack, it creates 1 mirror image (to a maximum of 3). The Mesmerist is Invisible while it has any mirror images, but each attack that misses the Mesmerist destroys 1 mirror image.

name: Memetic Magnetism
effect: The Mesmerist makes a tech attack against each hostile character within Burst 2. On a hit, until the end of the target’s next turn, they take {2/3/4} Heat after performing a hostile action that doesn’t include the Mesmerist as a target.

name: Codespike Rapier
on_hit: If the attack was made with Overwatch, the Mesmerist may immediately recharge one Mesmerist system or trait.

name: Death by Glamour
effect: Whenever an attack destroys a mirror image, the attacker takes 1 Heat.

name: Mountebank’s Jaunt
effect: When the Mesmerist hits with a tech attack, it may immediately escape all grapples and teleport to a free space adjacent to its target.

name: NARCISSUS Override
effect: The Mesmerist makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a hit, while the Mesmerist is within the target’s line of sight, their hostile actions must include the Mesmerist as a target until the end of their next turn.

name: Metafold Riposte
trigger: An ally within Sensors is attacked.
effect: The Mesmerist interrupts the attack by swapping places with the ally, each character teleporting to the other’s position. The Mesmerist then becomes the target of the attack, instead. After the triggering attack resolves, the Mesmerist may target the attacker with Overwatch.

name: Hypnotic Attraction
effect: The Mesmerist makes a tech attack against a target within Sensors. On a success, the target moves its maximum Speed towards the Mesmerist via the most efficient route possible. This movement is involuntary, but provokes reactions and Engagement as normal.

name: Salamander Thermobaric Catapult
effect:
This weapon attacks by drawing its Line in any direction from a point within its Range. It calculates cover and line of sight from the chosen point.

Targets who take Burn from this weapon must pass an Agility save or be Slowed until they clear Burn.

name: Heat Haze
effect: The Napalm has soft cover against characters in the Danger Zone.

name: Insulated
effect: The Napalm has Immunity to Burn.

name: Smolder Charges
effect: The area targeted by the Salamander Thermobaric Catapult becomes a smokescreen 4 spaces high that provides soft cover against attacks made within or through it. Attacks affected by this cover treat their target as Invisible. The area lasts until the start of the Napalm’s next turn.

name: Corrosive Gel
effect: Characters Slowed by Salamander Thermobaric Catapult are also Shredded until they clear Burn.

name: Firefly Drone
effect:
Firefly Drone (Size 1/2, HP {5/8/10}, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone)

This drone can be deployed to a space within Sensors and line of sight, where it constantly hovers 5 spaces above the ground. As a protocol or upon deployment, the Napalm may move the drone up to 5 spaces in straight line; the spaces below this path are set on fire and become difficult terrain until extinguished or until the start of the Napalm’s turn. Characters that end their turn within the area or move into one for the first time in a round take 2 Heat and {2/3/4} Burn. Only one drone may be deployed at a time; deploying a new drone destroys the old one.

name: Incendiary Grenade
effect: Two Blast 1 areas in Range 10 are set on fire and become difficult terrain until extinguished or until the end of the scene. Characters that end their turn within either area or move into one for the first time in a round take 2 Heat and {2/3/4} Burn.

name: Long-Burn Catalyst
effect: Characters hit by the Salamander Thermobaric Catapult gain +1 Difficulty on Engineering checks and saves and cannot clear Heat except by overheating. These effects last until the end of the target’s next turn.

name: FLOCK Drones
effect:
FLOCK Drone (Size 1/2, HP 1, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone)

Upon activating this system or entering the scene, the Occultist deploys 2 of these drones adjacent to it. While adjacent to at least one drone, allied characters gain soft cover and hostile characters take 1 Heat after each action they take. Only 5 drones may be deployed at a time.

name: Diviner’s Darts
effect:
This weapon can attack 1–2 targets at a time.

On Attack: A controlled Drone within Sensors may move adjacent to the target.

name: Reap the Chaff
effect:
Destroy a controlled Drone or allied Grunt in Sensors not deployed this round for these effects:

  • Allies adjacent to the target gain Overshield {3/5/7} and clear Impaired and Lock On.
  • Hostile characters adjacent to the target gain Lock On and must pass an Agility save or become Jammed until the end of their next turn.

name: Jealous Flock
effect: While adjacent to a FLOCK Drone, the drone’s allies gain Resistance to all damage from hostile sources, and hostile characters are Shredded.

name: Lead Astray
effect: Make a tech attack against a Drone within Sensors. On a hit, the Occultist controls the target Drone until the end of its next turn.

name: Scapegoat
trigger: An ally within the Occultist’s Sensors and Range 3 of a controlled Drone or allied Grunt is hit by an attack or fails a save against an effect.
effect: The controlled Drone or allied Grunt becomes the target of the attack or effect, instead.

name: Harvest Pyres
effect: When a controlled Drone or allied Grunt in Sensors is destroyed, hostile characters adjacent to the destroyed character must pass an Engineering save or take 2 Heat and {2/3/4} Burn.

name: Call From Below
effect:
MOLOCH Drone (Size 3, HP {15/20/25}, Evasion 6, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone)

As a full action, destroy a controlled Drone or allied Grunt in Sensors and deploy this drone in one of that character’s spaces. Hostile characters that start their turn adjacent this drone or move adjacent to it for the first time in a round must pass a Hull save against the Occultist’s Save Target or be grappled by the drone.

name: Prismatic Projector
effect:
Place an untargetable holographic projector in a free space within Sensors. The Prism is treated as occupying a projector’s space for all purposes. The Prism gains Resistance to all damage, Heat, and Burn inflicted through a projector.

Only 1 projector may exist at a time; placing a new projector first destroys an old one. Projectors last until the end of the scene, or until the Prism is Stunned, Jammed, overheated, or destroyed.

name: Diffraction Beam
on_hit: If the Prism consumed Lock On against the target, while the Prism is within the target’s line of sight, their hostile actions must include the Prism as a target until the end of their next turn.
effect: This weapon does not affect allies.

name: Refracting Armor
effect: Attacks targeting characters, objects, or spaces within Burst 3 of the Prism lose the benefit of Seeking. Hostile characters in the same area that attack one of the Prism’s allies gain Lock On.

name: Mobile Projectors
effect: The Prism may spend any amount of its voluntary movement to move a projector the same number of spaces. This movement triggers engagement and reactions as if the Prism were moving.

name: OMNIGLASS Barrier
effect: As a quick action, deploy one section of hard cover (Line 3, Size 2, 15 HP), within Range 3. Tech attacks and Seeking do not ignore this cover.

name: Shardsplitter Shotgun
effect: The Prism may Overwatch with this weapon when hostile characters enter or leave spaces within its Threat, regardless where their movement began.

name: Scintillating Gleam
effect: Create a Burst 3 area of glittering light until the end of its next turn. Hostile characters cannot draw line of sight to spaces in the area besides the Prism’s.

name: Shattered Glass
trigger: The Prism or an allied character in Range 3 is attacked while a projector exists.
effect: The Prism interrupts the attack by destroying a projector and teleporting the triggering character to a space it occupied. Regardless of Range or line of sight, the Prism becomes the new target of the attack as if it were targeted through a projector. Afterwards, the attacker is Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Amorphous
effect: The Torrent always has soft cover, and it ignores difficult terrain and engagement. Other characters can move through and end their turns in the Torrent’s spaces, and as long as it occupies at least 1 free space, it can end its turn overlapping obstructions, cover, or other characters.

name: Undertow
effect: Involuntary movement caused by the Torrent ignores difficult terrain. Hostile characters that collide with an obstruction or mech due to this movement immediately stop moving and must pass a Hull save or be knocked Prone.

name: Wavebreaker
effect: This weapon must inflict Knockback. The Torrent pushes itself to a space within the affected area.

name: Storm Surge
effect: The Torrent pushes itself 5 spaces in a straight line, ignoring smaller obstructions. Hostile characters that the Torrent passes through must make a Hull save or be pushed to a space adjacent to the Torrent at the end of its movement.

name: Scalding Greywash
effect: Hostile characters in a Cone 3 area must pass an Agility save or take {3/4/5} Burn and become Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Wash Away
effect: Against Prone characters, the Torrent may inflict Knockback in any direction.

name: Roil
effect: Hostile characters in a Burst 2 area must pass a Hull save or be knocked Prone and pushed 2 spaces away from the Torrent. The affected area then becomes difficult terrain for the rest of the scene.

name: Crashing Tsunami
effect: This weapon must inflict Knockback. The Torrent pushes itself to a space within the affected area. If the Torrent inflicts Prone, reload this weapon.

name: Drown in Nanites
effect: An adjacent character must make an Agility save; larger targets always succeed. On a success, the target is Slowed and Impaired until the end of their next turn. On a failure, the Torrent pushes itself to occupy the target’s space, and the target is engulfed until they pass a Hull save as a full action, they stop occupying the Torrent’s space, the Torrent is Jammed, Stunned, overheated, or destroyed, or the Torrent uses this action again. While engulfed, the target is Jammed and Immobilized and moves with the Torrent.

name: “Magpie” Subroutines
effect:
Destroy one of the following:

  • An adjacent wreckage.
  • A weapon or system equipped by the Vulture.
  • A weapon or system equipped by a willing adjacent character.

The Vulture or a character in Range 3 then gains one of the following benefits:

  • Recharge one weapon or system.
  • Repair one destroyed weapon or system.
  • Reload one Loading weapon or system.
  • All Limited weapons and systems regain 1 use.
  • Gain Overshield {3/5/7} and clear 1 condition.

name: “Condor” Jet Propulsion Wings
effect: The Vulture can fly whenever it moves or Boosts. It must land at the end of its turn or begin falling.

name: “Dandelion” Phosphorus Cannon
effect: On Attack: The area affected by this weapon provides soft cover until the end of the Vulture’s next turn. Characters at least partly within this cover cannot draw line of sight outside of its area.

name: Trash to Treasure
effect:
“Magpie” Subroutines gains an additional option when it destroys a wreckage:

  • Gain a weapon or system owned by the wreckage’s original character. It gains Limited 1, replacing any other value of Limited.

name: Jumpstart
effect: The target of “Magpie” Subroutines may immediately recharge {1/2/3} weapons or systems.

name: Opportunistic Salvage
trigger: A Drone or Deployable is destroyed within Range 3.
effect: Immediately use “Magpie” Subroutines, without needing to destroy a wreckage, weapon, or system.

name: Magnet Bomb
effect: Characters in a Blast 1 area in Range 5 gain Lock On and must make an Agility save. On a failure, all weapon attacks made against them gain Seeking until the end of their next turn, and they take {4/6/8} Explosive damage, half on success.

name: “Carcass” Reclamation Bunker
effect:
“Carcass” Reclamation Bunker (HP {15/20/25}, Evasion 5, E-Defense 5, Tags: Deployable)

Destroy an adjacent wreckage to deploy a Burst 2 bunker 4 spaces high centered upon it. Characters completely within the affected area gain hard cover against all attacks made from outside the bunker.

name: Zeal
effect:
The Zealot emanates an area of fervent energy, affecting non-Drone allies within its Sensors and line of sight; their weapon attacks made within the area gain Knockback 1 and AP against targets within the same area.

This effect lasts until the start of the Zealot’s first turn each round or until the Zealot is Stunned, Jammed, overheated, or destroyed.

name: Emberlight Nexus
effect: This weapon ignores Invisible and doesn’t affect allies. Characters that take Burn from this weapon lose Invisible and Hidden and can’t regain either until they clear all Burn.

name: Fanatical Charge
effect: The Zealot and up to one ally affected by Zeal gain Overshield {1/2/3} and may move up to 5 spaces as a reaction, ignoring difficult terrain, engagement, and reactions.

name: Blazing Fervor
effect: Allies affected by Zeal deal an additional 1 Burn on successful weapon attacks.

name: Flagellant’s Cleansing
effect: The Zealot clears up to one condition on each ally affected by Zeal. The Zealot gains each condition cleared until the end of its next turn.

name: Rally the Righteous
effect: Until the start of the Zealot’s next turn, allies affected by Zeal are treated as one Size larger for Grapple, Ram, and engagement. They may clear Slowed and stand up from Prone, then move up to 5 spaces as a reaction. This movement ignores difficult terrain, engagement, and reactions.

name: Brand the Heretic
effect: The Zealot makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a hit, the target gains Lock On. When an ally consumes this Lock On, they gain Overshield {3/5/7}, and any damage they deal to the target for the rest of the turn cannot be reduced in any way.

name: Martyrdom
effect: When the Zealot would take structure damage or be destroyed, it first grants Overshield {1/2/3} to each ally affected by Zeal and inflicts {1/2/3} Burn to each hostile character within the area of Zeal.

name: >//[ERR: DATA NOT FOUND]
effect: The Anomaly’s class and templates are not revealed to players until they Scan it.

name: Anomaly Features
effect: The Anomaly chooses one optional feature from this template's Optional Features or the Exotic Systems and Traits (Lancer, p. 327).

name: ¡@;!EXTR?UDE KNIFE
effect: THERE ARE ALWAYS MORE [KNIVES]

name: [HUNGER]
on_hit: The target may choose to spend 1 Repair to take half damage from this attack.

name: Feedback Lash
on_hit: After dealing damage, if the target has any Overshield, this weapon deals Energy AP damage equal to half the target’s Overshield to them and their allies within Range 3.

name: Memento Culpa
on_hit:
The target cannot voluntarily move closer to the Anomaly until the end of their next turn.

How could you leave them behind? They were your friends. Run away, just like you did that day.

name: Blinkspace Expulsion
effect: One character in Sensors must pass an Engineering save or become Intangible until the end of their next turn. On a success, they are instead Slowed and Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: Bottom of the Well
effect: One character in Sensors gains Lock On and must make a Systems save. On a success, the Anomaly chooses whether they are Immobilized, Impaired, Shredded, or Slowed until the end of the scene. On a failure, the Anomaly may instead choose {2/3/4} options, and the target is also Jammed until the end of the scene.

name: Forced Obsolescence
effect: The Anomaly forces a character in Sensors to make an Engineering save. On a failure, the Anomaly chooses one of the target’s weapons. That weapon loses all tags and modifications, then gains the Inaccurate and Ordnance tags. This feature can only affect a character 1/scene, and its effect lasts until the target finishes a rest.

name: Process Drinker
effect: The Anomaly makes a tech attack against a character with System Points (SP) within Sensors. On a hit, the target loses 1d3 SP. If this would leave the target over their SP capacity, they must mark equipment with SP costs as disabled until their new SP can accommodate the combined SP of their remaining equipment. Disabled equipment cannot be Activated, its passive effects are suppressed, and ongoing effects caused by that equipment immediately end. The target regains lost SP after completing a rest.

name: Stolen Cycles
effect: The Anomaly makes a tech attack against a character that can Overcharge in Sensors. On a hit, the Anomaly chooses an ally within Sensors. 1/scene, the ally may Overcharge using the target’s Overcharge counter. This increases the target’s counter, but the ally takes the Heat. This may affect a character only once per Full Repair.

name: Time Stop
effect: The Anomaly stops time, immediately taking an additional turn that doesn’t count against its turns per round. During this turn, other characters cannot act, the Anomaly is Immune to all external effects, and all characters are Immune to the Anomaly’s actions and abilities.

name: Astral Ejection
effect: When the Anomaly inflicts involuntary movement upon a mech, it may force the mech’s pilot to make a Grit save. On a failure, the pilot immediately Dismounts their mech, becomes Intangible, and becomes the target of the involuntary movement instead. The pilot remains Intangible until they end their turn in the same space as their mech, which causes them to immediately Mount it.

name: Counterfactualize
effect:
On a critical hit, the target must make a save using a pilot trigger of their choice. On a failure, they suffer the following effects:

  • Move all ranks from that trigger to a different trigger (chosen at random). This effect lasts until the character uses the chosen trigger as part of any downtime action.
  • The pilot takes AP damage equal to the ranks in that trigger.
  • If piloting a mech, the mech takes Heat equal to the ranks in that trigger.

Each character can be affected by this 1/scene.

name: Doppelgänger
effect: This replaces >//[ERR: DATA NOT FOUND]. The Anomaly appears to have the same class, template, Size, and appearance as another allied mech until a character Scans it. This otherwise does not affect its actual statistics or abilities.

name: Dust and Echoes
effect: When the Anomaly is destroyed, it creates an Intangible soul 1d6+3 spaces away in a random direction. This soul has {3/4/5} HP, Evasion 8, E-Defense 8, and Speed 3. At the end of each round, it loses 1 HP and moves up to its Speed towards the nearest wreckage. If it ends its movement within a wreckage, the wreckage absorbs the soul and reanimates as the mech it was before it was destroyed with 1 Structure, 1 Stress, and full HP, except it has the Anomaly template and this trait.

name: Elevator Clip
effect: The Anomaly cannot leave the ground. It instantly climbs to the top of objects or terrain without expending movement, and immediately descends to the ground without taking damage when falling.

name: Entropic Corrosion
effect: On a critical hit, the Anomaly may force the target to pass an Engineering save or lose 2d3 Armor, half on success. This can cause the target to have negative Armor. Therefore, incoming damage increases by the negative Armor value instead. The AP tag does not affect targets with negative Armor. The target can end this effect by Stabilizing and choosing to restore HP.

name: Harbinger
effect: At the end of any round while the Anomaly is destroyed, it may choose to re-emerge from an allied mech, transfiguring them into itself and killing any pilot inside. The allied mech becomes a copy of the Anomaly with full HP, no Heat, 1 Structure, 1 Stress, and the same expended abilities (such as those with Recharge, Limited, or 1/scene tags).

name: Heliocide
effect: When the Anomaly is destroyed, it becomes an invulnerable star of the same Size, obliterating its wreckage (if any). At the end of next round, the star explodes a Burst 20 area. All characters in the area not in hard cover or behind a character the same Size or larger as themselves must pass an Agility save or take {20/30/40} Energy AP damage, half on success. Each character can only be affected by this trait 1/round.

name: Local Climate
effect: The Anomaly is surrounded by a Burst 3 area under the effect of one environmental hazard (Lancer, pp. 278–279), to which the Anomaly is Immune.

name: Mass Inversion
effect: The Anomaly is Size 1/2. While it is on the battlefield, smaller characters are treated as larger characters and vice versa (e.g., Size 1/2 is treated as larger than Size 1, and Size 3 is treated as smaller than Size 2).

name: Metafold Hangar
effect: Spaces adjacent to the Anomaly may be treated as an Ingress Zone for deploying Reinforcements.

name: Spatial Rend
effect:
While the Anomaly is on the battlefield, when a hostile character teleports, that character must pass an Engineering save or become Shredded and Impaired until the end of their next turn.

When the Anomaly inflicts involuntary movement, it may treat that movement as teleportation.

name: Sympathetic Resonance
effect: The Anomaly deals half damage, Heat, and Burn on all abilities and attacks that affect a single target, but all of the target’s allied characters within Range 3 take the same damage, Heat, and Burn.

name: Animate Ammunition
effect: Weapon attacks made within the Anomaly’s Sensors gain the Smart tag if they lacked the tag or lose the Smart tag if they already had it. All tech attacks made in the area target Evasion instead of E-Defense. This effect lasts until the end of the Anomaly’s next turn.

name: Awakening
effect: The Anomaly targets a mech in Sensors. Up to {1/2/3} random systems without the AI tag installed on the target become NHP systems, gaining the AI tag and the ability to cascade. These may exceed the maximum number of AIs that can be installed on the mech, but while the mech exceeds its maximum AIs, it has +1 Difficulty on cascade rolls (to a minimum result of 1). These NHPs may be safely removed during a Full Repair.

name: Memory Leak
effect: A character in Sensors must choose {1/2/3} of their pilot talents. All ranks of the chosen talents cannot be used until the pilot completes a rest. Any ongoing effects caused by the chosen talent immediately end. A character can only be affected by this trait 1/scene.

name: Mind Freak
effect: The Anomaly selects two players. Those players exchange control of all of their characters and equipment, and they cannot communicate how to play those characters. This effect lasts until the two characters share a meaningful bond in any scene, as determined by the other players and the GM.

name: Realm Warp
effect:
The Anomaly creates two Blast 1 areas in Range 20, then chooses one of the following:

  • Swap the positions of all objects and terrain within the areas, teleporting them to the other’s spaces or, if those spaces are occupied, as close as possible.
  • Create dangerous terrain of a random damage type in the areas. These areas last indefinitely or until this option is chosen again.
  • Create impenetrable fog in the areas. Characters at least partially within one of the areas cannot draw line of sight outside of that area, and characters outside the areas cannot draw line of sight inside. These areas last indefinitely or until this option is chosen again.

name: Retroactive Vendetta
effect: Choose 1 hostile character and 1 allied character. The Anomaly rewrites history such that the ally becomes the sworn nemesis of the hostile character. The ally gains the Elite template if it previously lacked it and gains +1 Accuracy on all attacks, checks, and saves against their nemesis.

name: Revisionist History
effect:
One character with a Background within Sensors becomes Impaired and Slowed and must make a Grit check as their past is rewritten. On a success, the effect lasts until the end of their next turn. On a failure, the effect lasts until the end of the scene, and they must change their Background to a different, random Background. A character can be affected by this trait only 1/mission.

While the target’s Background has changed, skill checks they attempt that would have benefited from their previous Background gain +1 Difficulty. This effect ends after the target performs a downtime action related to their former Background. Alternatively, the target may accept their new Background as their “true past,” keeping it but otherwise ending this effect.

name: Self-Mechanization
effect: The Anomaly chooses one piloted mech within Sensors. The pilot must make a contested Grit check against the better of the mech’s Systems or Engineering. On a failure, the pilot and all other occupants meld with the mech, unable to leave it by any means. If the mech is destroyed, all melded occupants become Down and Out; if its wreckage is destroyed, all occupants die. Success or fail, the pilot and mech become Impaired until they succeed on a Grit check at the end of their turn. Extricating the mech’s occupants requires a downtime action.

name: Singularity Generator
effect:
The Anomaly creates a Size 1 indestructible miniature black hole in an adjacent space and chooses a direction. At the end of each round, the black hole moves 4 spaces in a straight line in that direction, and all characters on the battlefield are pulled a number of spaces towards the black hole equal to 4 minus the character’s Size. The black hole inflicts 100 Kinetic AP damage to objects or terrain it collides with. Characters that collide with the black hole must pass a Hull save or lose 1 Structure, or be reduced to 1 HP on a success.

The Anomaly is Immune to the black hole’s effects. The black hole lasts until the end of the scene or until another black hole is deployed.

name: Soul Split
effect: The Anomaly chooses an allied mech without the Grunt template in Range 10. The target gains the Grunt template, keeping existing templates but setting each of its HP, Structure, Stress, and turns each round to 1. The Anomaly then creates {1/2/3} copies of the character in free spaces within Range 3 of the target (or as close as possible). The copies may act this round.

name: Dirty Fighting
effect: On a critical hit, the Brigand’s target must pass a Hull save or be knocked Prone.

name: Jury-Rigged
effect: The Brigand gains +1 Difficulty on all checks and saves for one mech skill (chosen at creation): Hull, Agility, Systems, or Engineering.

name: Brigand Features
effect: When choosing optional systems, the Brigand may choose from this template's Optional Features and the Pirate Systems and Traits (Lancer, p. 328).

name: Finishing Blow
effect: The Brigand deals +3 bonus damage against Prone targets.

name: Surgekiller
effect: The Brigand’s critical hits deal 2 Heat against targets with at least 1 CP.

name: Shredding Claws
effect:
The Brigand forces an adjacent character to make a Hull save. On a success, the target is Shredded until the end of their next turn. On failure, the target suffers an effect depending on its character tag:

  • If the target is a mech, vehicle, or ship, on a failed save the target’s cockpit is ripped open, allowing its pilot or crew to be targeted and affected by outside sources. The target can reseal the cockpit as a full action.
  • If the target is a pilot or biological, they are Grappled by the Brigand. A mounted character is forced to immediately exit their mech, vehicle, or ship as though Dismounting.

name: Vandalize
effect: The Brigand makes a contested Hull check against a character it has grappled and is larger than for the sake of grappling. The winner chooses one of the target’s intact weapon mounts; all weapons on that mount are destroyed. The grapple then immediately ends.

name: Commandeer
effect:
The Brigand targets one hostile Deployable or Drone. Until the end of the scene, the Brigand is treated as the controller of the target Deployable or Drone. Attacks, checks, and saves made or forced by the Drone use the original controller’s statistics. Drones cannot be recalled while affected by this system.

The original controller can regain control and end this effect with a successful Systems check as a quick action while the affected Deployable or Drone is within their Sensors and line of sight.

name: Enforce Limiters
effect: The Brigand enforces reactor limiters on one hostile mech in Sensors that can Overcharge. The target must pass an Engineering save or become Overheated (Conditions & Statuses, Appendix A) until they remove the limiters with a successful Engineering check as a full action.

name: Grav Amp
effect: The Brigand makes a tech attack against a character in Sensors. On a hit, the target is knocked Prone and takes Kinetic AP damage equal to their remaining Repairs.

name: JAIL//BREAK
effect: The Brigand targets one hostile mech with the AI tag within Sensors. That mech must succeed on a Systems save or have all their installed AIs enter cascade. AIs immune to cascade are unaffected.

name: Lockout
effect:
The Brigand forces a hostile mech within Sensors to make a Systems or Engineering save (target’s choice). On a failure, the Brigand disables up to {1/2/3} of the target’s systems until the end of the scene. Disabled equipment cannot be Activated, its passive effects are suppressed, and ongoing effects caused by that equipment immediately end.

The target may end this effect with a successful Systems or Engineering check as a full action.

name: Rescind
effect:
The Brigand rescinds 1 license rank of a hostile mech in Sensors. While the target carries equipment tied to that license rank (not including the mech's Frame), they count as piloting an unlicensed mech (Lancer, p.74). An affected mech can jettison any piece of equipment as a quick action, rendering it unusable until it is retrieved and reattached during a rest.

Otherwise, this effect lasts until the target finishes a rest or succeeds on a Systems check as a full action to re-validate their licenses.

name: You’re Too Slow
effect: This template may only be taken by an NPC with less than 3 Speed. This NPC’s Speed becomes 3.

name: Cool as a Cucumber
effect: This template may only be taken by an NPC with more than 1 Stress. Gain +2 Heat Cap.

name: Mass-Produced
effect:
The Formation is composed of four independent, identical characters, each with their own spaces and statistics. Each member gains the following characteristics:

  • It has 1 HP and cannot gain any more. It takes no damage on successful saves.
  • It can never have more than 1 Structure and 1 Stress, and it is immediately destroyed if it takes any Heat from hostile sources.

All members of a Formation act on the same turn, subject to the following limitations:

  • Each member has its own standard movement.
  • Members share the same pool of actions per turn, obeying the rules for duplicate actions. For example, on one turn, one member may Skirmish while another Boosts.
  • Abilities with expendable uses (such as those with Recharge, Limited, or 1/Scene tags) share their uses across all members (so if one member uses a Recharge 4+ ability, none of the others may do so until it Recharges).
  • The Formation’s abilities with lasting effects are shared across all members. For example, all members of an Assassin Formation may benefit from Assassin’s Mark (Lancer, p. 289), but none of them can choose a new target until the current one is destroyed.

This template counts as the Grunt template (Lancer, p. 327) for the purposes of objectives and additional templates. A Formation cannot take any other template that grants it Structure, Stress, or more than one turn per round.

name: Novel Technology
effect: Attacks against the Prototype have +1 Difficulty until a character Scans them or an identical character (i.e., an NPC with the same class, templates, and features belonging to the same faction).

name: Prototype Features
effect: When choosing optional features, the Prototype may choose from this template’s Optional Features or features from any other NPC class.

name: AUNTIE-Augmented Minigun
effect: The Prototype gains the AI tag, but cannot cascade. On the same turn as attacking with this weapon, the Prototype may take one of the following actions as a free action once before the end of the turn: Boost, Grapple, Hide, or Ram.

name: Bleeding Edge
effect: On Critical Hit: The target begins to “bleed” (whether that be blood, fuel, or another fluid). At the end of each of their turns, they must pass an Engineering save or take {3/4/5} Kinetic AP damage. This effect lasts until the target succeeds on the save or Stabilizes to clear Burn.

name: Multi-Harpoon Shotgun
on_hit: The target must make a Hull save or be pulled directly adjacent to the attacker (or as close as possible) and Grappled by the attacker.

name: Thunder Lance
on_hit: As a full action, the Prototype may Boost in a straight line towards a hostile character and Skirmish against them with this weapon, ignoring engagement. On a hit, the Prototype and the target continue moving in the same direction together for a number of spaces equal to the Prototype’s remaining Boost movement.

name: Antigravity Uppercut
effect:
One character adjacent to the Prototype must make an Engineering save or take {4/5/6} Kinetic damage and be launched upwards 5 spaces into the air. Once aloft, the target is Immobilized and treated as if it were in zero-g; it may be freely pushed, pulled, and knocked back through the air.

This effect lasts until the end of the target’s next turn, at which point it floats gently to the ground without taking damage from falling. A character can only be targeted with this system 1/scene.

name: Chain Surge
effect: Choose another character in Sensors and line of sight. If the character is hostile, they take {2/3/4} Energy damage; if allied, they gain Overshield {2/3/4}. The Prototype may repeat this effect against a different character not yet affected by this system within the target’s Sensors and line of sight. This system may only affect {3/4/5} characters in a single use.

name: Doomscroll
effect: Make a tech attack against a character in Sensors. On a hit, they are inundated with ads, spam, and fake outrage posts, gaining 2 Heat and becoming Impaired. They remain Impaired until they succeed on a Systems save at the end of their turn; on each failed save, they receive an additional 2 Heat. Each character may only be affected by this system 1/scene.

name: Xnopyt Potato
effect:
Make a tech attack against a non-Drone character in Sensors. On a hit, they must choose one the following:

  • Become Shredded and Slowed until the end of their next turn.
  • They and all targets previously affected by this action gain 1 Heat, and they choose a different non-Drone character in Sensors previously unaffected by this action to receive its effect.

name: EMP Shielding
effect: The Prototype can still attack with its weapons while Jammed.

name: High-Friction Treads
effect: The Prototype receives only half of any inflicted push, pull, or knockback.

name: ICE Cracker
effect: Each time the Prototype misses with a tech attack or a Smart weapon, it gains +1 Accuracy on tech attacks and Smart weapon attacks. This stacks up to +3 Accuracy, but the effect ends once the Prototype hits with a tech attack or Smart weapon.

name: Infoscramble Cloak
effect: The Prototype is Invisible until a character Scans them or an identical character (i.e., an NPC with the same class, templates, and features belonging to the same faction).

name: Lightning Rod
effect: The Prototype has Resistance to Energy damage. In addition, if a character targets an ally in Range 3 of the Prototype with an attack that deals any Energy damage, the attacker must first pass an Engineering save. On a failure, the Prototype becomes the sole target of the attack; all other targets are unaffected.

name: Overclocked
effect: The Prototype may deploy with Heat equal to half its Heat Cap. While in the Danger Zone but not Exposed, the Prototype may Boost 1/round as a free action, and its attacks deal an extra 1 Heat on hit.

name: Specialized
effect: The Prototype chooses two different mech skills from Hull, Agility, Systems, and Engineering. It gains +1 Accuracy on checks and saves on the first mech skill and +1 Difficulty on checks and saves on the second.

name: Rebaked Bioplating
effect: The Prototype gains +1 Accuracy on Agility checks and saves, climbs and swims at normal speed, ignores difficult terrain, can jump its full Speed in any combination of horizontal and vertical movement, and can remain Hidden while Boosting. Additionally, the Prototype can Hide as a free action at any point in its Boost.

name: ROKO-Class NHP
effect: The Prototype has the AI tag. If a character in Range 3 takes a hostile action against a target other than the Prototype, they gain a Gaze mark. The Prototype can expend the Gaze mark to gain +1 Accuracy on an attack roll against the marked character or force the marked character to take +1 Difficulty on a save inflicted by the Prototype. This increases to +3 Accuracy and +3 Difficulty while the Prototype is in cascade.

name: Directional Hardlight
effect: The Prototype creates a Line 4 hardlight barrier 4 spaces high with at least one space adjacent to themselves. The barrier can overlap with characters and obstructions; characters that end their turn in the barrier or enter it for the first time in a round take {2/3/4} Burn. The barrier provides hard cover and blocks line of sight. It moves with the Prototype, remaining in the same relative position and direction. The barrier lasts until the Prototype uses this system again, or until it is Stunned, overheated, or destroyed.

name: Locomotion Mode Shift
effect: The Prototype shifts form; in this form, it gains +1 Armor and +2 Speed and ignores difficult terrain. However, it can only move in a straight line, and cannot stand up from Prone. This effect lasts until the Prototype ends it with quick action.

name: “Raptor” Point Defense Drone
effect:
“Raptor” Point Defense Drone (Size 1/2, HP 5/8/10, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone)

This drone can be deployed to a space within Sensors and line of sight. Allied weapon attacks gain +1 Kinetic bonus damage against hostile characters within Burst 2 of this drone.

name: Slip Drive
effect: Teleport 2 spaces. This system can be activated even while Slowed or Immobilized.

name: Faraday Countermeasures
trigger: The Prototype or an ally in Range 3 would be Jammed, but is not currently Exposed.
effect: Instead of becoming Jammed, the triggering character may take 2 Heat and become Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Firewall Molt
effect: The Prototype interrupts the effect by deploying a holographic afterimage in an adjacent space. The afterimage has the same Evasion and E-Defense as the Prototype, but only 1 HP. While the afterimage persists, when a tech action affects the Prototype, the afterimage halts the effect, leaving the Prototype unaffected. Track each effect halted in this way; once the afterimage is destroyed, the Prototype immediately receives all halted effects as normal.

name: Tectonic Wave (Ultra)
effect: The Gravity Cannon may attack in a Cone 7 or Line 10 area. Upon attacking with the Gravity Cannon, the Anchor may create up to 3 pieces of Size 1 terrain or 1 piece of Size 2 terrain in the attack’s area.

name: Thunderfall (Ultra)
effect:
Mark a Line 15 path along the ground and all spaces adjacent to it for thunderfall, which is visible to all characters. At the end of the next round, the marked area detonates with the following effects:

  • Hostile characters in the detonation gain Lock On and must pass an Agility save or take {8/12/16} Energy damage, half on success.
  • Non-Drone allies in the detonation gain Overshield {4/6/8}.

name: Coherent Entanglement (Ultra)
effect: When a character becomes Intangible due to Paradox State, they remain Intangible until the end of the current turn. While Intangible in this way, they can target and affect tangible characters and objects, dealing half damage, Heat, or Burn.

name: Hurricane of Steel (Ultra)
effect:
The Hatchet may make one Thrown weapon attack against each hostile character in Range of its Thrown weapons, without needing to retrieve each weapon. Each attack creates a copy of the weapon that lands adjacent to the target’s space.

Until the end of the Hatchet’s next turn, it may take a second full action to teleport adjacent to one of its Thrown weapons, then retrieve all its Thrown weapons. All hostile characters adjacent to a retrieved weapon must pass an Agility save or be pushed 2 spaces in any direction and take {6/8/10} Kinetic damage. On a success, the target takes half damage and isn’t pushed. This counts as damage from Cleaving Retrieval.

name: Mortal Draw (Ultra)
effect: If the Kensei takes the final NPC turn of the round, for that turn the Charged profile of its “Minuano” Kinetic Saber may attack characters in Burst 2.

name: Evergaol (Ultra)
effect:
Gaol Seal (Size 1/2, HP {15/20/25}, Evasion 5, E-Defense 8, Tags: Deployable)

Deploy an immovable gaol seal to a free space in Range 3. The seal creates a Burst 4 area that must completely contain the Knight and at least one duel opponent. The Knight and its duel opponents cannot leave the area and are Intangible within it.

The area lasts until the seal is destroyed, the duel ends, or until the Knight is overheated. The Knight takes 1 Heat when it ends its turn in the area.

name: Dimensional Raid (Ultra)
effect: If a character takes Heat from Memetic Magnetism, the Mesmerist may teleport to a space adjacent to them and attack them with Overwatch.

name: Skyburner (Ultra)
effect: When attacking with the Salamander Thermobaric Catapult while in the Danger Zone, the Napalm may instead draw two Line 5 areas anywhere in Range. The attack targets characters in the areas and up to 10 spaces above them. Targets within both areas are only attacked once.

name: Greater Good (Ultra)
effect: The Occultist destroys one non-Grunt ally in Sensors with only 1 Structure, and a different ally in Sensors regains all HP, clears all Heat and conditions, and gains the Elite template.

name: Flashbang Projector (Ultra)
trigger: An attack hits the Prism through a projector.
effect: The Prism attacks with the Diffraction Beam through the same projector; the triggering character must be included in the attack. Afterwards, the projector is destroyed.

name: Split the Sea (Ultra)
effect: The Torrent occupies two independent spaces of its Size, dividing its actions and movement between the two as it desires. Either set of spaces is valid for targeting the Torrent, though the Torrent is still only a single character and may only be affected once by a single area of effect. Involuntary movement against one set of spaces only affects the targeted spaces, but other effects are otherwise shared between the two. The Torrent is unaffected by its own weapons and effects.

name: Rapid Refabrication (Ultra)
effect: The Vulture may use “Magpie” Subroutines as a full action for an additional 2 Heat. If it does, it chooses a second option to destroy, then chooses a second benefit. The second benefit may target the same character or a different one.

name: Undying Faith (Ultra)
effect: Non-Grunt allies affected by Zeal that would be destroyed are instead reduced to 1 Structure and 1 HP. Allies with Zeal are unaffected by this trait.

name: Slingshot (Veteran)
effect: While Lodestone is active, allied characters may target the Anchor with ranged weapons as if attacking it (excluding Blast, Burst, Cone, or Line weapons). The Anchor automatically redirects the attack against a new target of the attacker’s choice within Range 10, resolving the attack as if it originated from the Anchor.

name: High Voltage (Veteran)
effect: Allies benefitting from Power Surge emit a Burst 2 area of electricity. Hostile characters that start their turn in the area or enter it for the first time in the round take {2/3/4} Energy AP damage.

name: Maxwell’s Demon (Veteran)
effect: Reduce the Heat gained to 0.

name: Pull the Snare (Veteran)
effect: When using Cleaving Retrieval, all characters in a Line between the Hatchet and its retrieved weapon must make an Agility save or be knocked Prone.

name: Pommel Launcher (Veteran)
effect:
Add this profile to the “Minuano” Kinetic Saber. This profile can only be used while this weapon is sheathed. After throwing this weapon, Mass Driver Sheathe cannot be used until it is retrieved.

This weapon becomes unsheathed after attacking.

name: Valor (Veteran)
effect: When the Knight uses Compelled Duel, it may choose an additional target to duel. It may use Compelled Duel again so long as it has no more than two duel opponents.

name: Hall of Mirrors (Veteran)
trigger: An ally in Sensors is attacked while the Mesmerist has at least 1 mirror image.
effect: The Mesmerist grants the triggering ally Invisible against the attack. If the attack misses, destroy 1 mirror image.

name: Reactor Accelerant (Veteran)
effect: Targets affected by Adhesive Gel take 1 Heat each time they fail an Engineering check to clear Burn.

name: Doubling Season (Veteran)
effect: Reap the Chaff may destroy two targets at a time. If it does, the Occultist may deploy 1 FLOCK Drone adjacent to itself as a free action for 1 Heat.

name: Double Vision (Veteran)
effect: The Prism may have 2 projectors at a time and place 2 projectors for each use of Prismatic Projection.

name: Primordial (Veteran)
effect: The Torrent becomes Size 3, and its weapons gain Knockback 1.

name: Grapplescrapper (Veteran)
effect: The Vulture may use “Magpie” Subroutines upon wreckages, weapons, and systems in Range 3.

name: Fire and Brimstone (Veteran)
effect: Hostile characters in Zeal’s area take 2 Burn each time they fail an Engineering check to clear Burn.
